title: Compiler bootstrap infrastructure and tests should be exercising `-g` more aggressively

labels.name: A-testsuite
labels.description: Area: The testsuite used to check the correctness of rustc

labels.name: A-debuginfo
labels.description: Area: Debugging information in compiled programs (DWARF, PDB, etc.)

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
On https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/93006 a change landed that broke `rustc -g` for unsized tuples, in a manner that ICE'd the compiler.

We didn't notice that it happened until nearly two weeks later, when  #93866  and  #93871 were filed.

The reason I'm filing a bug is that we have tests of unsized tuples; even the libcore test suite itself uses them. (I.e., this bug broke my attempts to bootstrap Rust itself with `debuginfo-level = 2` in the `config.toml`. But the test suite itself is not exercising `-g` enough to observe that combination.

At the very least, PR's that are making changes to debuginfo should be going through the process of bootstrapping with `debuginfo-level = 2`, as a sanity check.
